Sentencas: Ni-Ce0.8Gd0.2O1.9 (CCO) cermet anodes of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs) were prepared by the iso-static pressing method, which were sintered at 1450 degrees C and successively reduced at 700 degrees C with H-2 diluted by 80% He.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The resulting anodes were characterized by the pore structure measurements, SEM, XRD and EDS as well.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conductivity and the electrical performance in corresponding cells were also measured.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The prepared Ni-CGO cermet anodes mainly possess the pores of 1 similar to 2 mu m in diameter and the porosity of up to 30% that increases with the content of NiO.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It can be observed by the SEM measurements that the metal phase is well amalgamated with the ceramic phase and that the anode combines with the electrolyte tightly.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: NiO in the anodes can be reduced to Ni completely by the mixture of 20%H-2 similar to 80%He at 700'C without the phase transformation of CGO.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The conductivity of the reduced anode increases as the NiO content increases.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The threshold value of the NiO content is 40% in weight, over which the remarkable increase in conductivity is not available.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The fuel cells composed of Ni-CGO as the anode, CGO as the electrolyte and La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-alpha (LSCF) as the cathode provide with the power density of up to 0.14W/cm(2) at 650 degrees C.
Titulo: Anode of intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
